Importante periodista por la que nació 'Barbarita', la diva de 'Sábados Felices'
César Corredor, que es el hombre encargado de ponerse en los tacones, faldas y collares del personaje, contó cómo nació esta imprudente y reconocida señora.

07 Nov 2019, 17:47

El humorista aprovechó el famoso jueves de #TBT, de Instagram, para compartir una de las primeras fotografías de ‘Barbarita’, y en el post contó cómo empezó su historia.
“Aquí (la foto) me alistaba para imitar a doña Gloria Valencia de Castaño (periodista presentadora colombiana), no salió bien, pero la voz y la caracterización fueron luego mi inspiración”, explicó.
Además, Correa agregó que todo esto dio pie para recrear a su vecina, “llamada Bárbara de Monroy”, quien era muy parecida a su personaje, del que Jairo Susa realizaba los libretos.
Con todo lo anterior, se le dio vida a esta irreverente mujer, que con su inigualable imprudencia ha divertido a varias familias durante “más de 20 años”.

Important journalist for which 'Barbarita' was born, the diva of 'Happy Saturdays'
César Corredor, who is the man in charge of putting on the heels, skirts and necklaces of the character, told how this reckless and renowned lady was born.

07 Nov 2019, 17:47

The humorist took advantage of the famous Thursday of #TBT, of Instagram, to share one of the first photographs of ‘Barbarita’, and in the post he told how his story began.
“Here (the photo) I was getting ready to imitate Mrs. Gloria Valencia de Castaño (Colombian presenter journalist), it didn't work out, but the voice and characterization were then my inspiration,” he explained.
In addition, Correa added that all this gave rise to recreate his neighbor, “called Barbara de Monroy”, who was very similar to his character, of which Jairo Susa performed the librettos.
With all of the above, this irreverent woman was brought to life, who with her unique recklessness has entertained several families for "more than 20 years."
